channel.title: Command prompt error when trying to load client up! HELP PLEASE!
channel.description:
Ok so whenever i try to run a random server, the command prompt will come up with this error
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: client Caused by: java.lang.VlassNotFoundException: client at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run<unkown Source> at java.security.AccessController.doPrivilged<Native Method> at Java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass<Unknown Source> at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass<Unkown Source> at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass<Unknown Source> at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass<Unknown Source> Could not find the main class: client. Program will exit. Press any key to continue . . .
Idk if i set up my environmental variables wrong or something, some clients will work, and others wont. when i type in "Java" in the command prompt it works, same with "Javac" and i can run other clients, its just random clients it wont run. Please help, i need help

item.title: Command prompt error when trying to load client up! HELP PLEASE!
item.dc:creator: @gooasco gooasco
item.description:
@gooasco wrote:

cannot find client

this is what its saying

the compiler does not read .classfiles EVER it only reads .java

so youur client cant find Client.JAVA
try compiling then running the client

Read full topic
item.source: Command prompt error when trying to load client up! HELP PLEASE!

item.title: Command prompt error when trying to load client up! HELP PLEASE!
item.dc:creator: @kihomura Kihomura
item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

The main class file (in this case “client”) cannot be found. Try compiling before running.

item.title: Command prompt error when trying to load client up! HELP PLEASE!
item.dc:creator: @BlackHawk412 BlackHawk412
item.description:
@BlackHawk412 wrote:

Ok so whenever i try to run a random server, the command prompt will come up with this error

Exception in thread “main” java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: client
Caused by: java.lang.VlassNotFoundException: client
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivilged
at Java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass
at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass
Could not find the main class: client. Program will exit.
Press any key to continue . . .

Idk if i set up my environmental variables wrong or something, some clients will work, and others wont.
when i type in “Java” in the command prompt it works, same with “Javac” and i can run other clients, its just random clients it wont run. Please help, i need help
